name: com.xebialabs.xlplatform.endpoints.JythonRequest

methods.name: getEntity
methods.description:
Returns a deserialized entity in case of {@code POST, PUT} request. Will return {@code null} for {@code GET, DELETE}.
 If body of the request contained field {@code someField}, it will be accessible as {@code request.entity['someField']} in the script.

methods.name: getQuery

description: Request object of this class is always available as {@code request} inside Jython scripts which implement REST endpoints in XL extensions.

name: com.xebialabs.xlplatform.endpoints.JythonResponse

methods.name: setEntity
methods.description:
Sets body of the response which will be serialized into JSON and returned to the client. {@code response.entity=[{"foo": 42, "bar": "some value"}, 34]} Supported types are:
  • Standard JSON data types: {@code Number}, {@code String}, {@code Boolean}, {@code Array*}, {@code Dictionary*}
  • XL configuration items: ConfigurationItem
* {@code Array} and {@code Dictionary} can recursively contain aforementioned types as values of their elements.

methods.name: setStatusCode
methods.description:
Sets an HTTP status code for the response.
 Normally this HTTP status code will be returned to the client. E.g.: {@code response.statusCode = 307}.
 If this value is not set and script has been executed successfully, client will receive {@code 200}.
 If script throws exception which is not caught, this value will be ignored and {@code 500} will be returned.

description:
Response object which is always available as {@code response} inside Jython scripts which implement REST endpoints in XL extensions. The content of HTTP response returned to the client will be the following: 
 {@code 
  {
      entity: "object, or array",
      stdout: "Text which has been sent to standard output during the execution",
      stderr: "Text which has been sent to standard error during the execution",
      exception: "Textual representation of exception that has been thrown during script execution"

  }
 }
